answers.answer: I'm proud of you for getting involved in your health -it's so very important to keep up with your eye exams when you're a diabetic.  Make sure you get a baseline eye exam right away with an ophthalmologist, then get checked at least every year (and more often if advised by the ophthalmologist.)  Keep your blood sugar, blood pressure and cholesterol and lipids under  control - and just take good care of yourself.  If you take excellent care of your body - your eyes will thank you.For dry eyes - Systane, Refresh Tears, Genteal, Thera-Tears (all good artificial tear drops)For allergic eyes - Zaditor allergy drops over the counter.  Remember, I don't know your cases - so I can't properly comment on the care of your specific eyes.Take care.Michael Kutryb, MD
